subject: Hydraulic brake rod issue
description_text:
Hello, I believe I’m having issues with the adjustable hydraulic brake rod that came with my pro X ultra pedals. I haven’t used them for about a week and after going to play I noticed a click when braking. After further testing and inspection it is the adjustable brake rod. I have it removed for now but it seems to have lost the smooth feel it once had, it will click upon initial braking and click repeatedly if you stop and continue applying pressure. Is there anyway to fix this?

Get Outlook for iOS<https://aka.ms/o0ukef>

conversations.body_text: Hi Scott Krause, please provide your order number.

8202819374349390
Order ID from Ali express

Get Outlook for iOS<https://aka.ms/o0ukef>

Hi Scott Krause, Hello, could you please describe the issue you are experiencing? Kindly provide a detailed description along with videos or photos so we can better diagnose and resolve the problem for you.

I would describe the feeling as a “pop” or “dead zone” when applying pressure at the beginning and throughout the pedal range if you stop and continue. Although it’s not very audible my issue is the feeling while braking. I have attached videos with and without the hydraulics attached as well as manipulating by hand to attempt to replicate the “dead zone”

Get Outlook for iOS<https://aka.ms/o0ukef>

Couldn't fit all the videos, manipulated by hand attached
Get Outlook for iOS<https://aka.ms/o0ukef>

Hi Scott Krause, Please upload the video to Google Drive and share the link with us. Make sure the sharing setting is set to "Anyone with the link can view," otherwise we might not be able to access it. Since the platform limits direct uploads to 20MB, Google Drive is the recommended way to share larger videos. Once we receive the video, we’ll review it and assist you as soon as possible.

Got it. First link is with hydraulic rod
Second is without hydraulic rod
Third is hand manipulation

https://drive.google.com/file/d/10PE1wIri5XMdPpZBeXPfZjJkIvtDYla2/view?usp=drivesdk

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1I9v7k6nkUHDYlCO1nuBOZbD4qkHhEvd/view?usp=drivesdk

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mlBUq54NqMsbUt8nsMOJR5EgwCL2qS4T/view?usp=drivesdk

Get Outlook for iOS<https://aka.ms/o0ukef>

Hi Scott Krause, After reviewing the issue, it appears that there is no major problem with the product itself. During installation, a small amount of pressure needs to be applied to the hydraulic damper before tightening the mounting screws for optimal performance. To ensure everything works smoothly for you, we will send you a new brake hydraulic rod and a throttle hydraulic rod free of charge. Please kindly provide the following information: Full Name Contact Phone Number Shipping Address (including country and postal code) Once we receive the details, we will arrange the replacement shipment as soon as possible.

that would be greatly appreciated
Scott Krause
16198308938
29 Davidson st Chula Vista CA 91910 United States

Get Outlook for iOS<https://aka.ms/o0ukef>
Hi Scott Krause, Your order has been shipped. The logistics number is:JSEIQ1079197331YQ. You can track it at this website https://www.17track.net/zh-cn.

Hello, I have received the parts. Regarding the adjustable hydraulic brake rod, the one I received is far better than my current one. There is no play or "dead zone" at the beginning of compression. Thank you for the parts, I love the product and the customer service is amazing. Again, thank you.

Get Outlook for iOS<https://aka.ms/o0ukef>
